article.headline: Brown 70, Maine 68
article.story: ORONO, Maine -- Rafael Maia scored 21 points and grabbed a team-high eight rebounds to help Brown hold off Maine 70-68 Saturday in a nonconference matchup. Sean McGonagill added 16 points and Matt Sullivan chipped in 12 for Brown. Sullivan (9), McGonagill (7) and Maia (3) combined to make all 19 of Brown's free throws. Brown (1-1) led 38-33 at halftime but Maine used an 11-6 run to tie the game at 44-all. The game remained close throughout the remainder of the second half, as the score was tied seven times over the final 12 minutes. But Maine (0-2) was unable to take the lead as Brown used 11 second-half free throws to hold on. Justin Edwards led Maine with 14 points and Alasdair Fraser (10 points, 10 rebounds) added a double-double. Brown has won the last two of three games against Maine and holds an 8-6 series advantage.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
